output.dependency: The name of the beer (column 2) indicates its style (column 3) since the style is typically derived from the beer's name or follows a naming convention.
The brewery name (column 8) provides context to the location (column 9), as breweries generally have locations where they produce their beverages.
The size of the beverage container (column 4) relates to the alcohol content (column 5), where certain size formats may have a typical range of alcohol percentages associated with them.
The first column (presumably an ID) might be syntactically linked to the beer's serial number or distinct identifier in the database (column 1), indicating an incremental relationship.
